intro: Tylecodon bayeri, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and vibrant, showy flowers that resemble tulips. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers with a distinctive red or orange center, blooming in spring. Its leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Tylecodon bayeri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
